title: Crystal Palace Debuts in Europe, Faces Liverpool in Community Shield 2025
snippets: Palace will play in European competition for the first time this season, a reward for winning the FA Cup in May

Mohamed SalahThe official lineups for the Community Shield have been announced. Mohamed Salah and Hugo Ekitike are in the starting eleven.Liverpool kick off their 2025-2026 season this Sunday. The Red...

• Minute-by-minute updates on the action at Wembley

  • Silence for Jota cut short |
FA Cup winners Crystal Palace face Premier League champions Liverpool in the Community Shield. Watch the match live on Sportsnet and Sportsnet+ starting at 10:00 a.m. ET / 7 a.m. PT.
titles: Where to watch Liverpool vs. Crystal Palace: Community Shield live stream, start time, how to watch
Community Shield: Salah and Ekitike start against Crystal Palace
Crystal Palace v Liverpool: Community Shield – live
FA Community Shield on Sportsnet: Liverpool vs. Crystal Palace
summary: Crystal Palace, having won the FA Cup in May, will compete in European competition for the first time this season. They face Premier League champions Liverpool in the Community Shield. The match features Mohamed Salah and Hugo Ekitike in the starting lineup for Liverpool, marking the start of their 2025-2026 season. The game is broadcast live on Sportsnet and Sportsnet+ and includes a moment of silence for Diogo Jota, which was cut short.

title: Two Japanese Boxers Die from Injuries After Tokyo Fights
snippets: A second Japanese boxer has died from brain injuries suffered during separate bouts at the same event in Tokyo.
The Japanese athletes, both 28 years old, were rushed into emergency surgery after competing in separate bouts on August 2.

Japanese boxers Shigetoshi Kotari and Hiromasa Urakawa have died following brain injuries sustained while competing on the same card, although in different fights, at Korakuen Hall in Tokyo on Aug. 2.
Hiromasa Urakawa has become the second boxer to die from brain injuries sustained at the same event in Tokyo.
titles: Second boxer dies from brain injury after Tokyo event
Japan: Two boxers die from brain injuries at Tokyo event
2 Japanese boxers die after injuries on same card
Two boxers die after competing at same event in Japan
summary: Japanese boxers Shigetoshi Kotari and Hiromasa Urakawa died following brain injuries from separate fights at an event in Tokyo's Korakuen Hall on August 2. Their deaths occurred days apart after competing on the same card. This tragic outcome has been confirmed by boxing associations and media reports.

title: NFL Rookies, Free Agents Scrutinized in Preseason Week; Hunter Debuts
snippets: How did rookies and top free agent acquisitions fare in the NFL's first full preseason week?
The two-way Colorado star took his first NFL snaps Saturday
Travis Hunter’s professional debut included 10 snaps on offence, eight on defence and no highlights.

Here's exactly how the Jaguars used Travis Hunter in the rookie's NFL preseason debut against the Steelers
Travis Hunter plays offence, defence in pro debut as Jaguars lose to Steelers
summary: Rookies and top free agent acquisitions in the NFL's first full preseason week were closely watched. Travis Hunter, a two-way Colorado star, made his professional debut with 10 snaps on offense, eight on defense, but had no standout moments.

title: Critics Slam Canada's Handling of AI-Generated Hate Content
snippets: Experts and advocates say Canadian rules aren't keeping up with the pace of hateful artificial intelligence-generated content, nor adequately addressing the safety risks.

At first it appears to be a quirky video clip generated by artificial intelligence to make people laugh. In it, a hairy Bigfoot wearing a cowboy hat and a vest emblazoned with the American flag sits behind the wheel of a pickup truck. “We are going today to the LGBT parade,” the apelike creature say
titles: Concerns grow as AI-generated videos spread hate, racism online: ‘No safety rules’
‘No safety rules’: Concerns grow as AI-generated videos spread hate online
summary: Experts and advocates criticize Canadian regulations for not adequately addressing the rapid growth of hateful AI-generated content, exemplified by a video featuring a Bigfoot character making derogatory comments about the LGBT community. This highlights the need for updated policies to manage safety risks associated with such content.

title: NASCAR Leader Zilisch Breaks Collarbone in Victory Lane Fall
snippets: NASCAR Xfinity Series points leader Connor Zilisch broke his collarbone after a hard fall in Victory Lane at Watkins Glen International.
Zilisch landed hard on the ground during the fall, but later said everything was OK beyond the broken bone
titles: Zilisch breaks collarbone in scary Victory Lane fall
Connor Zilisch suffers broken collarbone after falling off his car in Victory Lane after NASCAR Xfinity race
summary: NASCAR Xfinity Series points leader Connor Zilisch suffered a broken collarbone after falling in Victory Lane at Watkins Glen International. Despite the hard landing, Zilisch reassured that he was okay apart from the broken bone.

title: Ukrainian Drones Strike Major Refinery in Russia's Saratov Region
snippets: Drones launched by Kyiv are targeting deeper into Russian territory than in past, Al Jazeera's correspondent reports.
Ukraine’s General Staff said it made a successful drone strike early Sunday on a major refinery in the Saratov region, the latest in a series of attacks this month on Russian oil facilities.
titles: Ukraine says it hit Russian oil refinery in drone exchanges; key talks loom
Ukraine Says It Strikes Russia’s Large Saratov Oil Refinery
summary: Ukrainian drones have targeted further into Russian territory, with a successful strike on a major refinery in the Saratov region reported by Ukraine's General Staff. This attack is part of a series of recent strikes on Russian oil facilities, indicating an escalation in Ukraine's drone operations.

title: Tribute to Diogo Jota Disrupted by Fans at Wembley
snippets:
• Minority of fans in Crystal Palace end disrupt silence

  • Liverpool forward and brother died in July car accident

Tributes were paid to former Liverpool forward Diogo Jota before the Community Shield but the minute’s silence at Wembley had to be cut short becau
A minute's silence held in tribute to Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva was interrupted by a minority of Crystal Palace fans before being cut short ahead the Community Shield against Liverpool.
titles: Minute’s silence for Diogo Jota cut short at Wembley before Community Shield
Jota tribute cut short after Wembley boos
summary: A tribute to former Liverpool forward Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva, who both died in a July car accident, was disrupted at Wembley before the Community Shield match. A minute's silence was cut short due to disturbances caused by a minority of Crystal Palace fans.

title: Trump Proposes Ukraine-Russia Territory Swap, Faces Criticism from Ukraine
snippets: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has staunchly rejected a suggestion by Donald Trump of 'swapping territory’.
The Ukrainian leader’s blunt comments risk angering President Trump, who has made a peace deal between Ukraine and Russia one of his signature foreign policy goals.
titles: Zelenskyy rejects ‘gifting land’ to Russia ahead of Trump-Putin meeting
Zelensky Rejects Ceding Territory to Russia After Trump Suggests a Land Swap
summary: President Donald Trump is scheduled to meet with President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on Friday, where he has proposed that Ukraine and Russia consider a territory swap as a means to achieve peace. This suggestion comes as part of Trump's broader goal to broker a peace deal between the two nations. However, the idea has elicited sharp criticism from the Ukrainian leadership, potentially straining relations with President Trump, who views the peace agreement as a key objective of his foreign policy.

title: Trump Open to Ukraine's Inclusion in Putin Talks, Allies Support Kyiv

Europe promises to ‘stand firmly’ with Ukraine as Trump and Putin prepare to meet for summit on Friday

The Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, has welcomed a statement from European allies that insists the “path to peace in Ukraine cannot be decided without Ukraine”, before a planned
titles: Ukraine's European allies say peace talks must include Kyiv
Zelenskyy welcomes European leaders’ demand peace talks must include Kyiv
summary: The White House has indicated that President Trump is open to including Ukraine in discussions with Putin scheduled for Friday. This comes as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy states that any agreement made without Kyiv's involvement would be ineffective. Ahead of the summit, European allies have expressed their support for Ukraine, asserting that peace in the region cannot be achieved without its participation.

Police arrest 532 people at London protest over Palestine Action ban

snippets: TORONTO — Like some superhero channelling the power of lightning, Algoma Steel Inc. has started using the heat cast off by the arcs of powerful electric currents to make greener steel. Electric arc furnaces are nothing new — the technology is more than a century old, and there’s al

TORONTO — Like some superhero channelling the power of lightning, Algoma Steel Inc. has started using the heat cast off by the arcs of powerful electric currents to make greener steel. Electric arc furnaces are nothing new — the technology is more than a century old, and there’s already a few in Can
titles: Greener steel arrives in Canada to a market in turmoil and future unclear
Greener steel arrives in Canada to a market in turmoil and future unclear
summary: Algoma Steel Inc. in Toronto has begun utilizing electric arc furnaces, an established technology, to produce more environmentally friendly steel. By harnessing the heat from electric currents, the company is innovating in the steel industry to reduce its carbon footprint.

title: Chavarria, Adidas Criticized for Alleged Cultural Appropriation in Mexico
snippets: He has apologised over the Oaxaca Slip-on, inspired by sandals made by Indigenous artisans, after criticism from Mexico.
Fashion designer Chavarria and Adidas are under fire in Mexico, where authorities accuse their latest design of appropriating an Indigenous sandal.
titles: Adidas designer sorry for shoes 'appropriated' from Mexico
Mexico: US designer regrets 'appropriated' Adidas shoes
summary: Fashion designer Chavarria and Adidas faced criticism from Mexico for allegedly appropriating Indigenous sandal designs in their Oaxaca Slip-on. Following the backlash, Chavarria has issued an apology. The controversy centers around accusations from Mexican authorities that the design infringes on the cultural heritage of Indigenous artisans.

title: UK to Deport Most Foreign Criminals, Ban Re-entry
snippets: Offenders would be barred from re-entering England and Wales under new government plans

Deported offenders will be barred from re-entering UK and measures will apply to those in custody too to cut costs

Most foreign criminals convicted by a UK court will be deported immediately, instead of 30% of the way through their prison sentences, under plans announced by the government.<
titles: Foreign criminals to be deported from UK immediately after sentencing
Foreign criminals convicted in UK to be deported immediately under new plans
summary: The UK government has announced plans to immediately deport most foreign criminals convicted in UK courts, a change from the current policy where only 30% serve part of their sentence before deportation. Additionally, deported offenders will be prohibited from re-entering England and Wales. This move aims to reduce custody costs and applies to those currently in custody as well.

title: Portugal Mourns UK Family Killed in Alentejo Car Crash
snippets: Town hall officials in Mourao have declared two days of mourning, starting today.

Four members of family from Thetford, Norfolk, died after car collided with another vehicle in Alentejo region

A UK family have been killed in a car accident while holidaying in southern Portugal, local authorities have confirmed.

Domingos Serrano, 55, his wife, Maria, 51, and their 2
titles: Tribute after family die in Portugal holiday crash
UK family killed in car crash on holiday in southern Portugal
summary: Officials in Mourao, Portugal, have declared two days of mourning after a tragic car accident in the Alentejo region resulted in the deaths of four UK family members from Thetford, Norfolk. The victims were identified as Domingos Serrano, 55, his wife Maria, 51, and their two children. The family was holidaying in southern Portugal when their car collided with another vehicle.

title: EU Leaders Call for More Pressure on Russia Before Trump-Putin Summit
snippets: Leaders of six European nations and the EU call for more pressure on Russia before Trump-Putin summit in Alaska.
For President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, it is an opportunity not just to end the Ukraine war on his terms, but to split apart the Western security alliance.
Washington’s push to negotiate an end to the war has raised concerns the Trump administration will make concessions to Moscow that Kyiv finds unacceptable.
titles: Europe promises to ‘stand firmly’ with Ukraine as Trump, Putin plan summit
With Ukraine in the Balance, Trump and Putin Head Into Summit With Mismatched Goals
Ukraine and Europe Project United Front Ahead of Trump-Putin Summit
summary: Leaders of six European countries and the EU have urged for increased pressure on Russia ahead of a scheduled summit in Alaska between President Trump and President Putin. The meeting, set for next Friday, aims to discuss a resolution to the Ukraine war. European leaders express concerns that the summit could allow Putin to achieve his goals on his terms, potentially fracturing the Western security alliance.

title: Crew-10 Astronauts Safely Return After 5-Month ISS Mission
snippets: The landing marks a successful end to their mission on board the International Space Station to help stranded pilots.
The Crew-10 mission, returning on a SpaceX capsule, had replaced astronauts Wilmore and Williams, who were stranded aboard the International Space Station for nine months.
titles: Astronauts return to Earth in SpaceX splashdown after 5-month ISS mission
NASA astronauts return to Earth from ISS after five months
summary: Four astronauts successfully returned to Earth on Saturday, concluding their five-month mission aboard the International Space Station (ISS) where they replaced stranded astronauts Wilmore and Williams. The Crew-10 mission, utilizing a SpaceX capsule, parachuted into the Pacific Ocean off the Southern California coast, marking a successful end to their journey initiated to assist the pilots of Boeing’s Starliner.

title: Canada's June Trade Balance Report Due Tuesday

titles: Five things to watch for in the Canadian business world in the coming week
summary: Statistics Canada is set to release its merchandise trade balance report for June on Tuesday. Economists are keenly anticipating this data to assess the ongoing impact of global economic conditions on Canada's trade. This release is a critical indicator of the country's economic health, focusing on the difference between its imports and exports.
constructiveness_reason: The story informs about an upcoming event that could impact the reader's understanding of Canada's economic health. It provides context about the importance of the trade balance report, which could be useful for decision-making in various sectors.

Despite concerns due to his age, ESPN's Jeremy Fowler reports that the team has taken a cautious approach with Stafford, who is expected to be ready for the regular season after the Rams' preseason win over the Dallas Cowboys.

summary: Jacksonville Jaguars kicker Cam Little successfully made a 70-yard field goal during a preseason game against the Pittsburgh Steelers. Despite the impressive distance, the kick will not be recorded in the official NFL record books due to it occurring in the preseason.

title: US Consumers Face Slight Inflation Rise from Higher Import Duties in July
snippets: The core consumer price index rose 0.3% in July, according to the median projection in a Bloomberg survey of economists. In June, core CPI edged up 0.2%.
titles: US inflation to rise as higher tariffs feed through
summary: In July, US consumers likely saw a small increase in underlying inflation due to retailers raising prices on goods affected by higher import duties. This indicates a gradual rise in prices for various items.

snippets: Economists are most effective at being irrelevant.
titles: The Federal Reserve’s ‘Interest On Reserves’ Doesn’t Contain Inflation
summary: This statement expresses a critical opinion on the relevance of economists, suggesting they are not effectively contributing to their field or societal issues. It lacks specific examples or outcomes, making it a general critique rather than a detailed analysis.

title: Hawai'i Oceanographers Discover Giant Virus with Unusually Long Tail
snippets: University of Hawai'i at Mānoa oceanographers have identified PelV-1, a dinoflagellate-infecting giant virus whose micron-length tail reaches 2.3 µm, stretching current notions of viral architecture.
titles: A giant virus wags its tail
summary: Oceanographers from the University of Hawai'i at Mānoa have discovered a giant virus named PelV-1 that infects dinoflagellates. This virus is notable for its unusually long micron-length tail, measuring 2.3 µm, challenging existing understandings of viral structures.

title: Deep-Sea Fish Vital in Earth's Carbon Cycle, Study Finds
titles: Deep-Sea Fish Are Secretly Shaping Earth’s Carbon Cycle
summary: Research reveals that deep-sea fish play a significant role in Earth's carbon cycle by consuming and redistributing carbon. These fish, residing at depths below 200 meters, contribute to carbon sequestration by moving carbon from the surface to the deep ocean. This process, often overlooked, highlights the importance of deep-sea ecosystems in global carbon management and the need for their protection to maintain Earth's carbon balance.

title: Insects Vital for Ecosystems, Support Biodiversity
snippets: Insects are arguably the most important animals on the planet. Their variety is unparalleled in nature, and they carry out vital tasks such as pollinating plants and providing food for other animals.
titles: Climate-fueled El Niño events are devastating butterflies, beetles and other tropical insects
summary: Insects play a crucial role in ecosystems by pollinating plants and serving as a food source. They are diverse and essential for maintaining biodiversity.

title: Rapid Glacial Erosion in Canadian Arctic Signals Urgent Climate Concerns
titles: Glaciers Are Changing Earth Faster Than You Think

This accelerated change is contributing to alterations in landscapes and potentially impacting global sea levels. Researchers emphasize the need for urgent attention to these changes to better understand their long-term effects on the planet.

title: Mathematicians Verify Decades-Old Tetrahedron Conjecture
snippets: A tetrahedron is the simplest Platonic solid. Mathematicians have now made one that’s stable only on one side, confirming a decades-old conjecture.
titles: This New Pyramid-Like Shape Always Lands With the Same Side Up
summary: Mathematicians have successfully created a tetrahedron that is stable on only one side, verifying a conjecture that has been debated for decades. This achievement highlights a significant advancement in the understanding of Platonic solids, with the tetrahedron being the simplest form among them.

title: Immune Cells Linked to Alzheimer’s Resilience, Study Finds
titles: Some Brains Stay Sharp Thanks to a Plaque Eating Immune Cell That Fights Alzheimer’s
summary: Researchers have discovered that certain brains remain resilient against Alzheimer’s due to a specific type of immune cell known as microglia. These cells combat Alzheimer's by consuming the harmful plaques associated with the disease, thus helping to maintain cognitive function. This finding could lead to new treatments targeting these immune cells to fight Alzheimer’s.
